top_categories.workout_context: Race-pace efforts that mimic Highlands Gravel Classic's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
Highlands Gravel Classic's Chunky gravel, Loose rock forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 67 miles.
When someone attacks on chunky Ozark gravel with constant rolling hills, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
72ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Highlands Gravel Classic, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
67 miles on chunky Ozark gravel with constant rolling hills burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on chunky Ozark gravel with constant rolling hills. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
At Highlands Gravel Classic, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Highlands Gravel Classic. Train it until it feels boring.
Varied gradients on chunky Ozark gravel with constant rolling hills demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 4,850ft of climbing on chunky Ozark gravel with constant rolling hills does to your power file on race day.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Highlands Gravel Classic’s 67 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Highlands Gravel Classic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on chunky ozark gravel with constant rolling hills to build confidence. Expect: chunky gravel, loose rock, tree-covered roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and VO2max to prepare you for 67 miles of chunky ozark gravel with constant rolling hills in Goshen, Arkansas.
